doc.name: submit-form-ajax-with-callback
doc.synopsis: Execute a JavaScript function on succesfull Ajax post
doc.description:
When using Ajax (JavaScript) to submit a form you can trigger another JavaScript function (a callback) when the posting has been successful.

The JavaScript function will be loaded by WSForm on rendering the form.

Name your JavaScript file exactly as the name of the callback function. For example : Is your callback function named : myGreatCallBackHandler then the name of the file must be : myGreatCallBackHandler.js

Put your callback JavaScript in the WSForm extension folder : WSForm/modules/customJS

The callback function will receive the submitted form object.
doc.note:
• If your file does not exist or your function does not exist or mwidentifier is not "ajax", there will be no callback triggered
  • a function name must be camelCase. Also make a habit of never using spaces. (use them here and nothing will work)
